title: About Yun
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2



Self-Introduction
My name is Choi Yun Yu, I am a British exchanger from the University of Sheffield. I took this module because I am going to be producing a thesis next academic year and R Studio is a cohesive and concise way to organise data.
The weather in Singapore is far too hot for me, but after nearly two semesters, I feel myself getting used to it. I fear that when I return to the UK (which is snowing right now) I will have to live in bundles of clothes and heaters.

title: Yun’s Website
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

1 + 1

[1] 2



Dataset
For this project, I am going to be using a dataset from the UK’s National Statistics Office as it is available for public download, as required by law. Therefore, it was fairly simple to receive the dataset as excel tables. My only worry is converting it into a format suitable for R to work with.
I am going to be looking at the coronavirus and how it affected people’s daily lives. Although the dataset’s title is ‘Coronavirus and anxiety estimates’, the survey questions don’t actually involve coronavirus. It was conducted in 2020 (pandemic era) and asked about anxiety ratings affected by loneliness, marital status, sex, safety, work and disability.
